landingContent.heroSubtitle: Generate professional, AP-style press releases that are ready for media distribution and news coverage.
tips: Lead with the news - put the most important information in the first paragraph
Write for journalists - they're busy; make it easy to copy and paste your quotes
Include a strong quote - this is often what gets used; make it quotable
Keep it under 500 words - longer releases rarely get read completely

examples.title: Product Launch
examples.content: HEADLINE: [Company] Launches [Product] to Help [Audience] Achieve [Outcome] — LEAD: [City, Date] — [Company] today announced the launch of [Product], a new solution that helps [audience] [achieve specific outcome].

examples.title: Partnership Announcement
examples.content: HEADLINE: [Company A] Partners with [Company B] to Expand [Service/Market] — QUOTE: 'This partnership brings together [Company A's strength] with [Company B's strength] to deliver unprecedented value to [target audience].'

examples.title: Award/Recognition
examples.content: HEADLINE: [Company] Named to [List/Award] for [Achievement] — LEAD: [Company], a leader in [industry], has been recognized by [organization] for [specific achievement].

faq.question: What makes a good press release?
faq.answer: Newsworthy angle, clear headline, strong lead paragraph, relevant quotes, and a compelling call to action. Keep it under 500 words.

faq.question: How do I write a good headline?
faq.answer: State the news clearly, include your company name, and use active verbs. Avoid jargon and marketing speak.

faq.question: What should I include in the boilerplate?
faq.answer: A 2-3 sentence company description with key facts: what you do, when founded, notable achievements, and website.

faq.question: Where do I distribute press releases?
faq.answer: Direct outreach to relevant journalists, PR newswires (PRWeb, Business Wire), and your own newsroom page.
